title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
The first point is for the integrand only. At most 3 out of 4 points earned for a copy error in the integrand. Subsequent points may be earned.

The second and third points are for antiderivatives. At most 1 out of 2 antiderivative points earned if only one antiderivative is correct OR there is at most one arithmetic sign error in the antiderivatives.

The fourth point is for the limits of integration and evaluation.

Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes three of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all four of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
The first point is for the integrand only. At most 4 out of 5 points earned for a copy error in the integrand. Subsequent points may be earned.

The second point is for limits and Ï€. The third and fourth points are for antiderivatives. At most 1 out of 2 antiderivative points earned if only one antidifferentiation error OR there is at most one arithmetic sign error in the antiderivatives.

The fifth point is for the evaluation, which does not need to be simplified. An error with the factor of 9 applies to this point.

Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
